recipes.title: Smash Burgers
recipes.method:
1. Divide ground beef into 8 equal balls about the size of a ping-pong ball (3-ounces each); refrigerate.
2. In a small mixing bowl, whisk together mayonnaise, mustard, grated onion, hot sauce and Worcestershire to create a special sauce; refrigerate.
3. Using either a large cast iron griddle or 2 large cast iron pans heated to high, toast buns with butter; reserve to plates.
4. Space beef balls on hot cooking surface. Using a large metal spatula, smash each ball to 1/4-inch-thick patties. (Tips: using the handle of a second spatula to push down on the top of the spatula adds leverage. Using parchment helps avoid spatula sticking to beef.)
5. Season patties with 1-teaspoon of reserved special sauce per patty; salt and pepper. Sear 2-3 minutes or until some fat begins to bubble up in center of patty. Quickly flip and top all of the patties with a slice of cheese. Sear another minute and place a patty atop a cheese patty; remove from cooking surface.
6. Build burgers with a smear of special sauce on bottom bun followed by shredded lettuce, double burgers and top bun.
Video tutorial : https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=foD42-73wdI&t=91s

recipes.title: Grilled Pasta & Cheese Leftovers
ingredients: Leftover pasta from the other night
recipes.method:
1. Heat up the leftovers. Either microwave, or fry up on a skillet.
2. Warm a skillet to medium/low heat, and butter the bread on one side. 
3. On the buttered side, add some garlic powder, and parsley to your liking.
4. Grease your skillet, and place a piece of the bread, butter side down on the skillet.
5. Add a slice of cheese followed by a scoop of pasta.
6. Add another slice of cheese followed by another slice of bread, butter side up.
7. Using a spatula, gently flip over your sandwich on the skillet.
8. Continue flipping every 1-2 minutes, until you have your desired amount of browning on your bread, and your cheese is nice and melty.
9. Remove from skillet, cut diagonally, and Enjoy!!!
